name: Pensione Hotel Melbourne - by 8Hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a refurbished room, and it was very nice. Our room was quiet most of the time, but occasionally we could hear people in the next room sneezing, coughing, etc. The lifts in this hotel seem a bit dodgy - it appears that when they renovated them, all they bothered with were the cosmetics. Close to trams, which was good. I really enjoyed staying here. I think that once the renovations are complete this place will be even nicer.
reviews.title: Great for a weekend getaway.

likes.disliked: — That, as at the time of this review, it isn't fully refurbished yet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed in a renovated petite double for several nights, location was excellant in the fact that it is within walking distance to most places including, tram stop, spencer st station, south bank etc. Reception staff were very accomodating and friendly. The room size was fine for what we needed and very comfortable, however the bathroom was rather small with water going everywhere when we showered. We found that we could hear a lot of 'hotel' noises and were woken up EARLY (3-4am)EVERY morning (SAT-MON) by inconsiderate people walking down the hallway / talking / banging doors etc. Lifts were VERY slow to travel only a few floors. Dimly light hallways was different and unusual. No resturant/bar as yet, not many options in the way of close alternatives close by for a meal. Although theres a 24/7 on the corner and a convienence store up the road and the hotel promotes a cafe around the corner for breakfast. All up we enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel as a good option for budget travel.
reviews.title: Just as many positives as negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at the Pensione.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient...compact

likes.disliked: — Channel 7 wasn't working...glad I wasn't staying while the Olympics was on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very convenient to Airport Bus drop off at Southern Cross station.
reviews.title: Too long for bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Friendly staff and swift check-in...I arrived around midnight.
reviews.title: Should be used to show how not to renovate a hotel

likes.disliked: — Unusable badly designed facilites, bathroom smaller than ensuites on trains or boats.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Halls and passageways were a bit dark, and had initial issues with the swipe card...extra light may have helped.
reviews.title: Tiny, Noisy & VERY expensive in comparison !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed from 10/6 to the 14/6 to attend football found the staff very friendly and helpful, hotel located close to public transport (both Tram & Train). Walking distance to Etihad Stadium, the Crown and many other atractions.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room though small was comfortable and warm only downside was the Bathroom / onsuite was compact but served its purpose.
reviews.title: well located and cute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well placed hotel near all necessary forms of public transport, easily accessible from the airport via skybus and a 5 minute stroll from the spencer street terminal. Near metropolitan trains and trams.
reviews.title: UNIMPRESSED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service within the hotel was friendly and welcoming, the staff were outstanding compared to those in the 5 star hotels that I usually choose. The room met my expectations although as a very tall person I found the bed was slightly too short for me, but very comfortable in any case. The bathroom was compact but this was manageable. There was a lot of noise from other guests in the middle of the night from the hallway, but very little noise could be heard from the adjacent rooms. Overall it was a neat little base for an enjoyable stay in Melbourne.
reviews.title: Lovely service - trendy boutique hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Constant 'whirring' of washing machine spin cycle or airconditioner compressor throughout day and night that must have been on the other side of one of the walls. Remote for TV had gone missing. "Hot' water was a dribble and luke warm and experienced by other rooms as well. Staff unable to improve any of above complaints when I voiced them during our stay... NOT GOING BACK
reviews.title: A let down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a "petite double" directly with the hotel for $105 AUS/ $65 US per night, for the night of Nov 16. We took the skybus from Melbourne airport, which dropped us off at a subway station that was five minutes' walk from the hotel. We were exhausted from our 30-hour journey, but we managed to find the place easily. The room was tiny tiny tiny - and shaped like a shoebox with the bed at one corner and the bathroom at the other. The bed was heaven (we ended up sleeping for fifteen hours), but it was a double, not a queen, so I don't know if two normal sized adults would be comfortable in it (we are on the thinner side of normal). The room itself was tastefully appointed in greys and browns and creams. The bathroom was literally the size of a toilet stall, including the shower, but again, was very stylish and sleekly designed. I'd say this would be a room meant for sleeping only except that we ended up spending sixteen straight hours in it - we fell asleep at 2 PM, woke up at 3 AM, and left at 8 AM, and it was still comfortable. The hotel doesn;t have an attached restaurant (they said it was being renovated) but they do offer you a 20% discount at a cafe around the corner for breakfast. The location seemed great to me, but can't really say since we were in Melbourne only for a stopover on a Sunday, and most of the restaurants near the hotel were closed that day. For the price, it's a great deal though, especially for one or two nights.
reviews.title: Perfect for a short stay, especially for ectomorphs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pensione Boutique Hotel - Melbourne, Australia
reviews.title: It's a winner

likes.liked: — Clean and fresh rooms. Excellent staff.
likes.disliked: — Ensuite a little small but ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Date: 25th October 2008
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer: P. Hislop - Adelaide, South Australia
reviews.title: Excellent accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two mates and myself visited Melbourne for a day at the races.
reviews.title: Inexpensive, clean and friendly staff.. But extremely small bathroom!

likes.disliked: — Dimly lit hallway and tiny size bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent a wonderful 2 days at its sister hotel The Diamant in Canberra, booked the Pensione Melbourne for a weekend & loved every minute. Convenient, clean, friendly,inexpensive, fresh and recently renovated it's the best value in town. The bathrooms are very compact and the rooms on the small side but we only used them for sleep and freshening up. All in all brilliant. If only they had a place in a resort location somewhere.
reviews.title: Great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took this hotel as a Wotif special deal. After finding out which hotel I had I read the reviews. The noise problem worried me. I contacted the hotel and they told me they would do their best to give me a quiet room. They did. Although we could faintly hear the backpackers continuous party it was ok. Our room size was quite good. As indicated by nearly everyone, the bathroom is small, but adequate. The glass door which doesn't quite close is the only problem I found. Cleanliness was very good. Otherwise the fears raised on reading these reviews were unfounded.
reviews.title: Most fears unfounded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in a petite double for 7 nights, and really enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish

likes.liked: — Location, Decor, LCD TV with Foxtel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the room and bathroom is a bit on the small side for 2 people, but the stylish decor makes up for it.
reviews.title: Good location but a bit cramped!

likes.liked: — Helpful staff and free internet through wotif

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was great, close to Southern Cross station, trains, trams, Flinders St, Southbank. We got 20% discount at a nice little cafe around the corner (try the french toast, yum).
reviews.title: great location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a function to attend at Crown Casino and decided to spend the night in the city. We booked our room online through an online travel agent offering a reduced rate, but it didn't end up saving us any money.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel required credit card guarantee at check-in, but this is normal for many Melbourne hotels. Staff were polite, but not nice. Hotel is a bit of a maze and there is no-one to show you to your room, although that's to be expected given the price.
reviews.title: Good Things Come in Small Packages...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room and bathroom were clean but very small. Bed was tiny. Our room had a window looking onto a corridor, and the blind was barely adequate so we had minimal privacy. Whilst we weren't bothered by outside noise, we could hear everthing in the rooms around us.
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff, great stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are better options in Melbourne City for the same price.
reviews.title: Excellent location, room, and friendly staff. The bathroom is fine!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall pretty satisfied with the Pensione Boutique. The hotel embodies a charm that can't readily be found in its competition.
reviews.title: Very Happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Pensione Boutique hotel was in a very good location. It was a slow 5min walk to South Bank across the bridge and very close to the huge casino.
reviews.title: Great little hotel for short city stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and they managed to check us into the room even though it was early.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are VERY small, you could not swing anything in there let alone a cat! We were in Melbourne for 4 days and would have loved to unpack our cases but there was the smallest wardrobe you have ever seen that wouldnt have even fit our coats in!
reviews.title: This little hotel is great value for money in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: There was no room to even open your case on the floor. Yes it was ultra modern and had all the fancy furnishings like the plasma tv etc but practically it was tiny. I know that most city hotel rooms are small and places like London and New York are renound for this, but this room was a joke!
reviews.title: great value for money, very central, perfect for short city stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: i loved the decor and the location though and we were not in the room for that long, only to sleep and it was very clean.
reviews.title: Check your room first!

description: Modelled on the original European pensione hotels, the Pensione Hotel Melbourne combines original turn of the century building features with modern design and soft tones, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.Set behind a beautiful Heritage-listed façade, the Pensione Hotel offers boutique interiors, breathtaking hospitality and incomparable value for money.Featuring all the desired hotel amenities, with warm and inviting staff that have a great knowledge of the local area, the Pensione is perfectly suited as a base to explore Melbourne.
